conclusion: Analyze the p-V diagram to understand the thermodynamic processes and apply the first law of thermodynamics to calculate heat transferred.
The p-V diagram shows an ideal gas process from A to B (vertical, isobaric) and B to C (horizontal, isochoric).
Identify processes: A to B is isobaric (p_A = p_B), B to C is isochoric (V_B = V_C).
Calculate work done for A to B: W_AB = p_B * (V_B - V_A).
Calculate work done for B to C: W_BC = p_C * (V_C - V_B).
Apply first law of thermodynamics: Q = ΔU + W.
Assume ΔU = 0 for ideal gas at constant temperature.
Calculate heat transferred: Q = W_AB + W_BC.
Temperature in state A is 27°C, part of context but not directly used.
Final calculation: Heat transferred is sum of work done in processes.
